intro: Lithospermum virginicum, commonly known as Virginia rock pepper, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Lithospermum virginicum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
